author: Chelsea Todaro
title: Fla. gun company designs alleged ‘anti-terrorist’ assault rifle
text:
A Florida gun manufacturing company has sparked controversy among the Muslim community after it created a “Crusader” rifle “designed to never be used by Muslim terrorists,” the Orlando Sentinel reports.
Located in Apopka, Spike’s Tactical designed the AR-15 assault rifle with the Bible verse Psalms 144:1 laser etched on one side stating, “Blessed be the Lord my Rock, who trains my hand for war, my fingers for battle.” Etched on the other side is a shield with a cross meant to symbolize the Christian Crusades reclaiming the Holy Land from the Muslims, according to the Sentinel.
Spike's Tactical/YouTube video Tactical Crusader rifle But that’s not the only feature -- the gun even has three safety trigger settings labeled “Peace”, “War”, and “God Wills It.”
"Off the cuff I said I'd like to have a gun that if a Muslim terrorist picked it up a bolt of lightning would hit and knock him dead," said former Navy Seal and company spokesman, Ben Thomas, to the Sentinel.
When the rifle went on sale Wednesday it immediately aroused concern for the Council on American-Islamic Relations of Florida.
"Is it designed for Christian terrorists?" executive director of CAIR-FL, Hasan Shibly, told the Sentinel. "We need to have a conversation on gun violence. There has been utter silence from gun manufacturers. It's time for them to stop trying to make a buck on this.”
But Thomas said “the owners of Spike Tactical did not intend to insult or antagonize Muslims,” the Sentinel reports. “They believe America and much of the world is threatened by Islamic terrorism and the Crusader is a symbol of shared Christian values and the right to defend themselves,” Thomas added.
The company makes many specialized guns, even for women, but Thomas said they would never produce a gun with Koran verses on it for Muslim marksmen, the Sentinel reports.
Read more at orlandosentinel.com
